name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice and modern Hotel, staff is friendly and quick, breakfast is excellent for the italian standards, rooms are modern and have a certain Asian flair, this seems to be the theme of the Hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: I enjoyed the pool after a day walking around in sticky Milan!
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: Only downside is the location, unfortunatley a bit far out, however with a tram you will make it to Duomo in 20 min.
reviews.title: Great Value Hotel

reviews.text: For the price it was an excellent deal.
reviews.title: Luxury at a Reasonable Price

reviews.text: Lovely hotel about 20mins tram (number 12) from centre of Milan. Stayed here mid-August with wife and teenage son for 3 nights. Booking in was easy and staff are great - Marcia was extremely helpful about how to get to different places in Milan. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Breakfast was very good - plently of choice and good quality (especially the different breads) and staff very attentive.
reviews.title: Good deal

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in July and had a really nice time. We took the train from the airport and got to the hotel really easily. The main train station (near the university) was a good 15 mins walk away however if your bags are easy to carry its fine (if not get a taxi however I didnt see any at the station so im not sure how easy it is to hail one down). What can I say- this hotel was great. The hotel had really nice clean big rooms with a great vew of the city if you are on the top floors. Staff are friendly and give you good advice of how to get the best out of your stay in Milan. The hotel is also very good value for money considering how nice it is and compared to the other hotels in Milan. Breakfast is also very good with a wide selection of hot and cold food (inc english breakfast) and is open until 11am at weekends.The location is not central however you can get to town very easily eaither by tram or train. The train station is 5 mins walk (Villapizzone) and its 5 stops to town. The tram takes aprox 25 mins to Duomo (lovely catherdral in the centre of Milan and also very close to all the shops!) and the tram stop is really close by. The sales are all on in July so we also had a days shopping and got some good bargains ( hight street not designer). We also went to lake Como for the day by train and it was 1 hours travel and 4.50 EURO which was fantastic value- I would really reccommend this trip as it was the hightlight of our weekend. We also went out to some bars on sat night near the hotel (ask the hotel reception) 10-15 mins by tram/ 10 EURO in a taxi - it was buzzing and really busy. We had a fab time.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here July 2012 for three Nights. This hotel stands out when it comes to how friendly and helpful staff are. I could see how they strive to make their customers happy, even when the hotel is busy. This is four star hotel, with FIVE STAR service!
reviews.title: Best Staff !

reviews.title: A fine place to stay with pleasant rooms and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the urban rail system and got off at Villapizzone station which is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. It was not possible to check in as we arrived early and left our luggage with the concierge.
reviews.title: Good hotel with convenient transport links

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were helpful and gave us a map and showed us how to get to the Doumo. The number 12 tram stop was just yards away from the hotel and the direct route took about 25 minutes to the city centre.
reviews.title: Good hotel but a bit far out from the centre
Very good location in Milan
reviews.text: Alternatively, we could have caught the train at Villapizzone station. However, the journey would involve a change or two and would have taken longer. Nevertheless, we used the urban rail system to return to the hotel one evening as the number 12 route was suspended.

reviews.title: Bait and switch
reviews.text: Our three night stay was pleasant. The room was spacious, comfortable with tea/coffee making facilities, a safe and bar accessories like a corkscrew and a bottle cap opener. The large bathroom was well appointed with a bath and a great shower. Toiletries were renewed daily. Everything was spick and span as one would expect from the Radisson hotel group.

Overall, the location may be a little distant from the city centre but the area is quiet and away from the noise and traffic. The excellent transport links more than make up for the "inconvenience" of travelling into the city and we would stay at the Radisson again when we visit Milan.
reviews.title: Very nice stay at Radisson Blu Milan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 2 weeks in Croatia, we appreciate the super confort of this hotel, far from the city center (Middle of nowhere location...), but easy to reach with the tram #12 in 20 minutes. Everything is luxury, design and confort. We had a business class room with a large heaven bed. Included a very good breakfast. A good choice in Milano for the price
reviews.title: High Class! Extra confort! Like!
